subject: Re: [junit] Strange request: examples of "beautiful" test code
msgSnippet: ... Actually, that was JUnit 4 code.  I wonder why people keep bringing up TestNG all the time?  :-) Second, in most cases I find that asserting solely on an
messageBody:
On 11/28/06, Jeff Langr <jeff@...> wrote:
>
> I'd also have to agree that the TestNG style is more elegant.


Actually, that was JUnit 4 code. I wonder why people keep bringing up
TestNG all the time? :-)

Second, in most cases I find that asserting solely on an exception
> type is insufficient. Often (not always) I'm asserting some
> postcondition in the catch block, or I'm asserting some nuance of the
> exception object itself (message, typically).


Definitely. In those cases, it's definitely fine to revert to the old
try/catch pattern.

--
Cédric
http://testng.org


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
